Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: The problem with a patch like this is that it might break the existing habits of users — it removes functionality that was available before. Granted, the functionality is not very useful (I think), but is it bad enough to forbid it and risk breakage? I don’t think so. You can always reach any workspace by adressing it directly, e.g. “workspace "1: foo"”.

Author: anonymous
Comment:
That's up to you, you're the author. But according to me, I would prefer to have this warning (making the highlight on "x: " being a number for the workspace btw), rather than having the possibility to reuse a number and break the expected behavior of commands such as "workspace next_on_output".

I mean, breaking the next_on_output binding is more annoying than not being able to reuse an existing number (which is weird).
